originalText.text: I sincerely appreciate their initiative to employ and contract exclusively with mentally impaired people in their customer service department. It's heartwarming that they're so committed to uplifting such a marginalized group. Unfortunately, this does make it difficult to make informed decisions when I'm relying on accurate information from their customer services representatives to guide my course of action. Ultimately, I feel good supporting a company so dedicated to providing equal opportunity employment at the expense of the customer.

originalText.text:
Update: contacted the email address you provided, only to be told they couldn’t help. They then scheduled a call with department that could supposedly help. I was called and told they were the wrong department too. Now given number to lending department. The run around continues…

I used to work for Citi a long time ago and truly thought they were a good company until recently. I had a personal loan I took out with them, which was set up on automatic payments. I never made a late payment for 5 years. In the beginning of COVID, apparently I was offered a deferment on a payment, which I don’t even remember… fast forward to the end of my loan… I never received a notice that I had this extra payment due in full by a certain date, instead, one day after my automatic payment was scheduled and received by CitiBank, I get a notice that my account is 30 days past due. I call CitiBank (multiple times in one day, just trying to reach an agent I could understand on the phone. Every time I called it was like I was reaching someone that was outside in a windy area. It was unusual. And then I was transferred at least 5 times, having to reexplain myself each time instead of a warm transferred call.) and it was explained to me that I had a deferred payment that was due at loan maturity. I made the payment immediately on that phone call. I wrote the credit dispute department, explaining this and that I had perfect credit, would never make payments late or miss them, and asked for the derogatory mark be removed from my otherwise perfect credit report. I get a denial notice in the mail. Citibank, I will never do business with you again or recommend you to anyone until this mark is removed. You had a good paying customer, you made a good amount of money from the interest I paid you for 5 years, you offered me a deferment to help me and you screwed me in the end with your “help”. I also work in an industry where I can recommend different banks for loans. I’ll take all of my negative reviews down when I see you have removed this negative mark from credit report.

originalText.text:
Also frustrated as a new Citibank client.   Got a Costco visa for me and my business.  Set both on auto pay I spend twice as much as my credit limit every month so they should like that.   I have to go in and pay it off twice a month yet they only report once a month and my credit dropped 50 points this month.
They both increased my credit line and destroyed my credit score on the same month.

originalText.text: I Can never get through to customer service. The wire for brains AI is of absolutely no help. When you try to get through to an actual live person the Artificial Ignorant hangs up on you!

text.text: I Can never get through to customer service. The wire for brains AI is of absolutely no help. When you try to get through to an actual live person the Artificial Ignorant hangs up on you!

originalText.text: So Disappointing. Opened a business account with zero sales was granted $6k in credit on my card. Several years later, with sales 6 figure, they never raised my credit until I asked, to a mere $8K. The bankers at this branch are amazing, but unable to help me, despite my business bank account also being at Citi, so they could easily see my cashflow, and also I have been paying off my card in full every two weeks, so they will stop rejecting my card as it reaches its limit. Whatever algorithm is used to raise credit limit, I believe was overruled because I am a women running a home based business. I have no concrete proof, but believe I have been discriminated against. Went to another bank, and was same day give a credit line of $27K, so that is a bit a proof, no? I find it shameful to be treated this way, right around the corner from Citi Corporate Headquarters. Citi should stop advertising that they support women owned businesses, because they certainly do not. Rather they have been suffocating my business during my busiest time of year.
